flawed_nl_solution:
There were 30 + 20 = <<30+20=50>>50 attendees at the party.
A total of 50 x 2/5 = <<50*2/5=20>>20 people left the party.
Nine of those who left were men while 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 of them were women.
So, 30 - 11= <<30-11=19>>19 women stayed at the party.
And 20 - 9 = <<20-9=15>>15 men stayed at the party.
Thus, 19 - 15 = <<19-15=4>>4 more women than men stayed at the party.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 11, not 15. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
